bibl.title: Matoba Watari v. T. W. Lynch. Order Denying Writ and Withdrawing Exhibits
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: The District Court of the United States, Western District of Washington, Northern Division

div1.p: Order Denyting Writ and Withdrawing Exhibits
In the Matter of the Application of Matoba Watari for Writ of Habeas Corpus

IN THIS MATTER petition for a Writ of habeas corpus having been heretofore filed, and order having been granted requiring T.W. Lynch, Acting Commissioner of Immigration, to show cause why a writ of Habeas Corpus should not be issued herein, and upon the hearing of said order to show cause, the court having considered the evidence and having heard to argument of counsel thereon; it is

ORDERED, ADJUDGED AND DECREED that the said petition for a writ of habeas corpus, be and it is hereby denied, and that the petitioner remain in the custody of the said T.W. Lynch, Acting Commissioner of Immigration, for deportation according to the order of the Secretary of Labor; and it is further
ORDERED that the United States Attorney may withdraw the exhibits attached to the answer and return filed herein.
DONE in open court this 7 day of January, 1922.
In the District Court of the United States for the Western District of Washington.
In the Matter of the Application of Matoba Watari for Writ of Habeas Corpus
Order Denying Writ and Withdrawing Exhibits
Filed in the United States District Court
